intro: Linderniella andongensis, commonly known as the Andong lindernia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
